transcript.title: PM. 12/1966 - Death of Senator Sir Shane Paltridge
transcript.content:
FOR PRESS P.M.Â Â No. 12/1966

The death of Sir Shane Paltridge is a great blowÂ to the Government, Parliament, and people. It is a deepÂ sorrow for me, for he honoured me with a close personalÂ friendship, and by his character and achievements, togetherÂ with his unsurpassed integrity, inspired in me a very realÂ affection for him. He has left behind him an honoured name.

Shane Paltridge had a fine record as a Minister.Â He tackled no problem that he did not master. He was a veryÂ good administrator, and an unfailing source of wisdom andÂ good humour in Cabinet.
We are sad for his wife and family, and extendÂ our sympathy to them.

CANBERRA,
21st January, 1966.
